intro: Drusa acutangula, commonly known as the narrow-leafed drusa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is native to parts of southern Africa, including South Africa and Namibia. Drusa acutangula is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
